parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.
From the base of posis with enclitic adverb of origin; from which or what place, state, source or cause.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
A desert place, desert, uninhabited region. From eremos; solitude.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
Bread, a loaf, food. From airo; bread or a loaf.
To feed, satisfy, fatten. From chortos; to fodder, i.e. to gorge.
